definitions: viscous substance between liquid and solid states
clear jelly-like substance used to style or hold hair in place
examples: The nurse applied cooling gel to the burn area
Scientists created a new gel for medical applications
He used strong hold gel to spike his hair
The gel kept her curls perfectly defined all day

definitions: clear tasteless substance made from animal collagen used in food and medicine
examples: The dessert was made with fruit juice and gelatin powder
Gelatin capsules dissolve easily in the stomach for medicine delivery
She added gelatin to thicken the homemade marshmallows
Vegetarians often avoid gelatin because it comes from animals

definitions: male horse that has been surgically altered to remove reproductive ability
examples: The farmer's gelding was calm and easy to handle
Many riding schools prefer geldings for their gentle temperament
The chestnut gelding won first place in the jumping competition
She bought a gelding rather than a stallion for trail riding

definitions: cut and polished precious stone used in jewelry
person or thing considered outstandingly good or special
examples: The ruby gem sparkled brilliantly in the ring setting
She collected rare gems from different countries during her travels
The new restaurant is a hidden gem in our neighborhood
Her latest novel is an absolute gem of storytelling

definitions: mineral crystal cut and polished for use in jewelry or decoration
examples: The jeweler showed us various gemstones including emeralds and sapphires
Natural gemstones are more valuable than synthetic ones
She studied gemstone identification at the jewelry design school
The museum displayed rare gemstones from around the world

definitions: informal term for genuine information or useful intelligence about something
examples: What's the gen on the new company policy changes?
He gave me the gen about the best restaurants in town
I need the gen on tomorrow's meeting before I attend
She always has the latest gen on what's happening

definitions: member of the French national police force with military status
examples: The gendarme directed traffic at the busy intersection in Paris
Two gendarmes patrolled the village square on horseback
A gendarme stopped us to check our documents at the border
The local gendarme knew everyone in the small French town

definitions: national police force in France and other countries organized on military lines
examples: The gendarmerie headquarters was located in the town center
Officers from the gendarmerie investigated the rural crime
The French gendarmerie has jurisdiction in small towns and countryside
She joined the gendarmerie after completing her military training

definitions: person who studies and traces family histories and lineages professionally
examples: The genealogist helped us trace our family back five generations
A professional genealogist discovered we had royal ancestors
She hired a genealogist to research her Irish family roots
The genealogist spent hours examining old church records and documents

definitions: study of family ancestries and histories through generations
examples: She became interested in genealogy after finding old family photos
Online genealogy databases make researching ancestors much easier
His genealogy research revealed surprising connections to historical figures
The library has an extensive genealogy section with birth records

definitions: broad statement or principle derived from specific instances or examples
examples: His generalisation about teenagers was unfair and inaccurate
Scientific generalisations must be based on sufficient evidence
Making a generalisation from one bad experience isn't logical
The study's generalisation applied to most European countries

definitions: supreme commander of combined military forces, especially in certain countries
examples: The generalissimo commanded all branches of the nation's armed forces
Franco held the title of generalissimo during his rule of Spain
The generalissimo's headquarters coordinated the entire military campaign
Historical generalissimos often wielded enormous political power

definitions: person with competence in several different fields rather than specialization in one
examples: As a generalist doctor, she treats many different conditions
The company hired a generalist who could handle various departments
Generalist teachers can teach multiple subjects to younger students
He preferred being a generalist rather than a narrow specialist

definitions: quality of being general rather than specific or detailed
statement that is vague or lacking in specific details
examples: The generality of his advice made it hard to apply
We need specifics, not generality, in this proposal
She spoke in generalities to avoid committing to anything specific
The report's generality failed to address the real issues

definitions: broad statement or concept obtained by inference from specific cases
examples: That generalization about city people doesn't apply to everyone
Scientific generalization requires careful analysis of multiple data points
Her generalization was based on limited personal experience
Making a sweeping generalization can lead to misunderstanding

definitions: skill in leading and commanding military forces in planning and conducting operations
examples: His brilliant generalship led to victory despite being outnumbered
The battle demonstrated her exceptional generalship under pressure
Poor generalship resulted in unnecessary casualties during the campaign
Military academies teach the principles of effective generalship

definitions: machine that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy
person or thing that creates or produces something
examples: The hospital's backup generator kicked in during the power outage
We bought a portable generator for camping trips
The new software is a powerful generator of random passwords
She's a generator of creative ideas for the marketing team

definitions: product marketed without a brand name, especially a medication
examples: The generic version of the drug costs much less
Many stores sell generic products alongside name brands
Generic medications contain the same active ingredients as branded ones
She always buys generic cereal to save money

definitions: quality of being kind and generous in giving to others or sharing
examples: Her generosity helped many students afford college through scholarships
The community was touched by his generosity during the crisis
Their generosity with time and resources made the event successful
Acts of generosity can inspire others to give as well

definitions: scientist who studies genes, genetic variation, and heredity in organisms
examples: The geneticist discovered a link between the gene and disease
A team of geneticists mapped the human genome project
She consulted a geneticist about her family's hereditary condition
Geneticists use advanced technology to analyze DNA sequences

definitions: supernatural being from Arabian folklore that grants wishes when summoned
examples: The genie emerged from the lamp in a cloud of smoke
According to the story, the genie granted three wishes
She joked about needing a genie to finish all her work
The genie in the tale could transform into any shape

definitions: external organs of reproduction in humans and animals
examples: The doctor examined the patient's genitalia during the checkup
Medical textbooks include diagrams of male and female genitalia
Injuries to the genitalia require immediate medical attention
The sculpture's genitalia were covered for the public exhibition

definitions: grammatical case that indicates possession or close association between nouns
examples: In English, the genitive is often shown with an apostrophe
Latin has a distinct genitive case ending for nouns
The genitive form of 'child' is 'child's' in English
Students learned to identify the genitive case in German

definitions: deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular ethnic or national group
examples: The international court prosecuted leaders for committing genocide
Historical genocides serve as warnings against hatred and prejudice
The United Nations works to prevent genocide around the world
Survivors of genocide often struggle with trauma for generations

definitions: complete set of genetic material present in a cell or organism
examples: Scientists sequenced the entire human genome in 2003
Each species has a unique genome that defines its characteristics
The wheat genome is much larger than the human genome
Studying the genome helps researchers understand genetic diseases

definitions: genetic constitution of an individual organism distinguished from its physical appearance
examples: The genotype determines which traits an organism can pass on
Blood tests can reveal a person's genotype for certain conditions
Two organisms with the same genotype may look different environmentally
The plant's genotype included genes for drought resistance

definitions: informal short form of gentleman, a polite or well-mannered man
examples: The old gent tipped his hat as we passed
He's a real gent who always holds doors for others
The gent at the counter helped me find what I needed
Several gents in suits waited outside the club

definitions: plant with bright blue, yellow, or purple flowers found in mountain regions
examples: The blue gentian flowers covered the alpine meadow beautifully
Gentian root is used in some traditional herbal medicines
We spotted rare gentian species during our mountain hike
The gentian's vivid purple blooms attracted many photographers

definitions: person who is not Jewish, especially in historical or religious contexts
examples: The ancient laws distinguished between Jewish and gentile practices
In biblical times, gentiles and Jews had different religious customs
The apostle Paul preached to both Jewish and gentile audiences
The temple had separate areas for Jews and gentiles

definitions: process of changing a neighborhood through renovation and influx of affluent residents
examples: Gentrification pushed out many long-time residents who couldn't afford higher rents
The old warehouse district underwent rapid gentrification
Some view gentrification as neighborhood improvement, others as displacement
Rising property values from gentrification changed the area's character

definitions: people of good social position, specifically the class below nobility
examples: The local gentry owned most of the land in the county
Members of the gentry often served as justices of peace
The novel depicts life among the English gentry in 1800s
The gentry's influence declined with industrialization and social change

definitions: scientific study of the chemical composition of earth and its rocks
examples: Her geochemistry research focused on volcanic rock composition
Geochemistry helps us understand how minerals form underground
The geochemistry lab analyzed soil samples from the drilling site
Students in geochemistry learn about elemental cycles in nature

definitions: shortest possible line between two points on a sphere or curved surface
examples: Airline routes often follow geodesic paths to save fuel
The geodesic dome uses triangular elements for structural strength
Mathematicians study geodesic curves on various geometric surfaces
GPS systems calculate geodesic distances between locations on Earth

definitions: scientist who studies the physical features of earth and human activity
examples: The geographer mapped the changing coastline over decades
Ancient geographers created the first world maps
She became a geographer specializing in urban development patterns
Geographers study both physical landscapes and human populations

definitions: study of physical features of earth and atmosphere and human activity affecting them
examples: Students learn geography to understand different countries and climates
The geography of the region includes mountains, rivers, and plains
Modern geography uses satellite imagery and computer mapping
She teaches both physical and human geography at university

definitions: scientist who studies solid earth, rocks, and processes that shape them
examples: The geologist examined rock formations to determine their age
Oil companies employ geologists to find new drilling sites
A team of geologists investigated the earthquake's cause
She became a geologist after being fascinated by volcanoes

definitions: science that deals with earth's physical structure and substance and its history
examples: The geology of the Grand Canyon reveals millions of years
Students on the geology field trip collected rock samples
Local geology influences soil types and building foundations
She studied geology to understand natural disasters better

definitions: mathematician who specializes in geometry
examples: The ancient Greek geometer Euclid wrote fundamental mathematical texts
As a geometer, she solved complex spatial problems
The geometer calculated angles and distances for the construction project
Medieval geometers advanced understanding of shapes and measurements

definitions: branch of mathematics concerned with questions of shape, size, position, and space
examples: High school geometry covers triangles, circles, and proofs
The architect used geometry to design the building's unique angles
Ancient Egyptians used geometry to build the pyramids precisely
She found geometry easier to visualize than algebra

definitions: scientific study of landforms and processes that shape them
examples: Geomorphology explains how rivers carve valleys over time
The professor's geomorphology research focused on coastal erosion
Understanding geomorphology helps predict natural hazards like landslides
Geomorphology combines geology, geography, and environmental science

definitions: covering for the head and neck attached to a coat or separate
hinged metal cover over the engine of a motor vehicle
informal term for neighborhood, especially in urban areas
examples: She pulled her hood up against the rain
The monk's hood concealed his face in shadow
The mechanic lifted the hood to check the engine
Smoke was coming from under the hood of the car
He grew up in the same hood where his parents lived
Everyone in the hood knows each other's business

definitions: the first three letters of the alphabet
the basic facts or principles of a subject
examples: Children learn their ABCs in kindergarten class
The blocks had ABCs printed in bright colors
You need to master the ABCs before attempting advanced techniques
The instructor covered the ABCs of computer programming
